intro: Minuartia graminifolia subsp. brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petioled sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open, sun-exposed habitats where it can withstand harsh environmental conditions. This subspecies is notable for its resilience and is a common indicator species in high-altitude ecosystems.
